ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The ability to do my own research and put together a forty page paper

I am extremely glad I decided to take on writing a senior essay because it allowed me to dive deep into an area of interest. I learned a lot substantively about my topic and I also learned about the research and writing process since never before had I taken on a paper this grand in scale.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the philosophy department could benefit by having a short handbook/manual with some suggestions and guidelines for how to think about a senior essay in philosophy in terms of your topic, the process, your timeline, selecting an advisor, etc.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course if you have a topic you are excited to write about AND an advisor with whom you are excited to work. Because the senior essay in philosophy is so self-directed, it only works if you are motivated and genuinely dedicated to what you are doing. If that is the case, I would say definitely do it!
